sections.heading: Fruit Recommended Colors
sections.text: Use reds for apples and strawberries, oranges for citrus, yellows for bananas and pineapples, greens for limes and kiwis, and purples for grapes and plums.

tips.techniques: A. Blending Techniques: For a peach, use yellow as the base coat then blend oranges and reds on top to create a soft, natural gradient. B. Highlighting and Shadows: Apply white highlights where the fruit would catch light, like the top of an apple. Use darker shades underneath for shadows.
tips.challenge: Color a vibrant still life scene with a bowl of assorted fresh fruits using rich, complementary colors like oranges and blues. This warm and cool color contrast makes the fruits pop. It allows you to practice seamlessly blending diverse yet harmonious colors across objects.

crafts.title: 3 DIY Fruit Crafts
crafts.text: Get ready to go bananas with these fabulously fruity craft ideas! Supplies Needed: Instructions: Gather These: Steps: Youâ€™ll Need: Instructions: These juicy fruits are bursting with flavor and color, ready to make your pages pop! And look, their vegetable friends are joining in on the healthy coloring party, adding their greens and earthy hues to the mix!
